attributes.action: A new educational route to be taken learning about life skills
attributes.additional_details: Because young people don’t have a clue and it’s always Google or asking parents how to do it because they don’t get taught it in school, and when people come into schools to talk about it, it’s not realistic at all, and then young people are faced with unrealistic expectations and it’s all meant to be basic knowledge
attributes.background: Start teaching people in secondary school and above about life skills such as tax, insurance, going self employed, mortgages, loans, rent, cost of living, credit scores

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631393

You may also be interested to know that as part of the national curriculum content on citizenship schools are required to teach students about income and expenditure, credit and debt, insurance, savings and pensions, financial products and services, and how public money is raised and spent.

You can read the citizenship programmes of study here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study-for-key-stages-3-and-4
